intro: Brachystelma gerrardii, commonly known as the dwarf starling cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its compact, branching structure and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, which attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Brachystelma gerrardii is adapted to arid environments and stores water in its fleshy stems. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
